intro: Ruellia asema, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Ruellia asema thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
